description.medium: Lazercut acrylic lenses, stainless steel bridge, and high nickel alloy temples.
description.concept: Cateye glasses inspired by Americana and Nascar imagery.
Exploration and appropriation of the meme medium, online it-girls, and internet oversharing to discuss identity, race, and mental health.
Installation exploring intersections of private vs. public spaces and individual experiences within a collective experience.

A tarot deck designed from collected pieces of paper and the personal memories attached to them. It was created as an exploration of how meaning is attributed to tarot cards based on imagery and conventional understandings.

description.medium: Custom printed circuit board, lazercut acrylic, and chain
description.concept: An electronic amulet that receives power through the internet. This concept is inspired by the supportive comments often left on personal instagram posts by people that have often never met in person or are physically distant. In a way, through our connections on social media, we can give each other protection and support. The lighting pattern on the LEDs change based on likes and comments on the users instagram posts.

description.medium: website with ml5 KNN classifier teachable machine
description.concept: A teachable machine that allows the user to create digital asemic writing works with gestures. Inspired by the works of Cecil Touchon.
Video made in collaboration with Haiyi Huang. Music by fi ft. ammi.
A virtual memorial to TKettle on St. Marks (closed Fall 2017).

description.medium: Custom printed circuit boards and lazercut acrylic
description.concept: Part one of ITP thesis where the artist is examining the blurry line between “person” and “thing” by positioning herself as a cyborg making cyborgs. Person Thing #1 is a garment constructed of acrylic and printed circuit boards or pcbs with speakers and colored leds. The speakers are fed audio through aux cord inputs connected to mobile devices playing different videos. The audio quality is intentionally distorted with a lot of interference and feedback. The goal was to depict a synthetic skin that comes to life through media. The speakers’ audio blend together, conceptually imbuing the skin with media.

Part two of ITP thesis where the artist is examining the blurry line between “person” and “thing” by positioning herself as a cyborg making cyborgs. Person Thing #2 is an AR interactive sculpture. A ghostly human-scale 3D figure is placed on the ground in augmented reality. The ghost wanders around the area aimlessly but comes towards the viewer every so often. The ghost is made from media, a combination of 3D models of robot and anime figures readily downloadable from the internet. The goal of this piece was to create a digital synthetic ghost with a haunting presence.
